sense.name: a varied collection of things, a mixture
sense.commentary: ASSORTMENT[+entity][+group][+collection][+varied] [+quantity][+aggregation] Note: refers to things in the world.
sense.examples: Sally bought an assortment of Halloween candy at the grocery store. There was an interesting assortment of people at the town meeting last night. An assortment of clothes lay strewn across the floor of the bedroom.

sense.name: the act of sorting things into categories
sense.commentary: ASSORTMENT[+action][+sorting][+classification] Note: refers to the sorting of objects by an agent/actor.
sense.examples: John's assortment of people into winners and losers annoys Mary. You need to do an assortment of the clothes into lights and darks and run them separately through the wash.
